A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
I made an account just so i could give this movie a bad review - Fundamentally shattered my childhood love of Star Wars.

As a fan of the prequels and the original trilogy and even TFA\, i was so excited for this movie to build on the nostalgia from TFA and expand into a deeper richer storyline that focussed on 'world - building' as well as answering some of the questions from JJ Abrhams movie. 

Instead we got Leia Poppins\, a horrible unreferenced death for Admiral Ackbar\, a slow-speed chase\, porgs\, a Gringotts escape scene and not to mention the destruction of Cinemas most beloved character: Luke Skywalker.

Fans have waited 30 years to see him back in action\, and instead he was barely recognisable. 

Utterly crushed for the fans and Mark Hammil that it had to end this way.

And what was the point of the Rose/Finn storyline? Nothing.
What a pile of strange\, plot-holed\, confusing trash :(
